column4: looking for help with SisM650 video driver - I could not get any hardware acceleration with the driver provided at http://www.winischhofer.at/linuxsispart4.shtml#download
i flew over that site, sure there is hardware acceleration in the free version ? or do you have the premium version ?
- I downloaded the free version but it is not giving any improvement over the default FB driver that Ubuntu used
well, you better ask the makers...

and did you read this "Once again: There is no DRI/OpenGL/3D support for the SiS 6326, 5597/5598, 530/620, 315, 550, 650, 651, 740, 330, 661, 741, 760, 761 including all model variations with letters in the model number."

Additionally, a Linux kernel framebuffer driver for some SiS and XGI graphics cards is available here as well. This driver is meant for more advanced users as its installation requires some knowledge about kernel configuration and compilation. ;)
this could be interesting: "Sidenote: Since this seems to be a commonly made mistake: sisfb and the kernel's VESA framebuffer driver cannot be active at the same time!"
do you really need a bigger text console as the standard ?
then you dont need that sisfb (frame buffer)
thats another issue...
dunno if flash uses XV
I don't think it uses XV
becuase realplayer is playing the videos fine
how fast is your cpu ? (flash just sucks)
oh, well, that should be enough...
one more thing if you donot mind
i dont use flash, so dunno...
realplayer is playing video but audio is not coming
do other audios work ?
could be that you just have to select the right audio device (/dev/dsp)
and sure realplayer uses ALSA (as i dont use realplayer neither...)
and is there another programm using audio device ?
then start realplayer new
realplayers manual should say that. but i think its allso an option in realplayers preferences...
